case_title: SHABBIR AHMED SHAIKH vs GOVERNMENT OF BALUCHISTAN And OTHER

accussed_details.name: Shabbir Ahmed Shaikh
allegation: Default in payment of Rs. 83,445 to Respondent No. 2

complaint_summary: Petitioner challenged the withholding and transfer of his earnest money/security deposit of Rs. 80,000 by Respondent No. 3 to Respondent No. 2 after his highest bid in an auction was rejected without explanation.
investigation_summary: Petitioner continuously sought refund of the earnest money through legal notices and representations. Respondent No. 3 refused refund, citing arrears owed by the petitioner to Respondent No. 2.
judgment_summary: The court held that Respondent No. 3 acted without lawful authority in withholding and transferring the security deposit. Rule 225, sub-rule (6) of the West Pakistan Municipal Committees Octroi Rules, 1964 mandates immediate refund of earnest money if the bid is not confirmed. The petition was allowed, directing Respondent No. 3 to refund Rs. 80,000 to the petitioner.
punishment: Respondent No. 3 directed to refund Rs. 80,000 to the petitioner.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued that withholding the security deposit violated Rule 225, sub-rule (6) of Octroi Rules.
Respondent No. 3 lacked jurisdiction to transfer or withhold the deposit.
Respondent No. 2 could recover dues through legal proceedings but failed to do so.
Advocate-General argued delay and availability of alternate remedies barred the petition.
statutes: West Pakistan Municipal Committees Octroi Rules, 1964
West Pakistan Government Dues Recovery Ordinance, 1962
sections: Section 3 of West Pakistan Government Dues Recovery Ordinance, 1962
key_issues: Jurisdiction of Respondent No. 3 to withhold or transfer earnest money.
Applicability of Rule 225, sub-rule (6) of Octroi Rules.
Delay and laches in filing the petition.

maxims.Certiorari: Granted in cases of absence or excess of jurisdiction.

legal_terms.Earnest Money: A deposit made to demonstrate commitment in an auction or contract.
legal_terms.Writ Jurisdiction: Authority of a court to issue orders for legal remedies.

words_and_phrases.Adequate Remedy: A remedy that is prompt, convenient, and efficacious.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner challenged the unlawful withholding of Rs. 80,000 earnest money by Respondent No. 3, citing Rule 225, sub-rule (6) of Octroi Rules. The court ruled in favor of the petitioner, directing refund and allowing Respondent No. 2 to pursue legal recovery of dues.
